content.raw:
I agree the that the port argument should still be exposed but should default to the value in the labconfig.

And whilst it's true that local and remote lyse might have different ports, so far we have conflated the values in labconfig as meaning both, so we're not being inconsistent at least.

Until we see practical reasons for running multiple copies of the same program I'm inclined to not try to 'fix' the port problem. At the moment it's basically as if the programs have hard-coded ports, but with the ability to globally change the port of one of the programs if it clashes with something else on the system that would be running that program.
